video_description: Here is Lisa Gade's video review of the Toshiba Thrive 7" Tablet. The Thrive is available now for $379 to $429, and it's a WiFi-only Android Honeycomb 3.2 tablet. It has a high res 1280 x 800 display, a dual core 1GHz NVidia Tegra 2 CPU, a gig of RAM and 16 or 32 gigs of storage. It has a microSD card slot and HDMI out. Check out our full review here: http://www.mobiletechreview.com/tablets/Toshiba-Thrive-7.htm .
title: Toshiba Thrive 7" Tablet Review

comments.text: Nexus 7 has NO expandable SD option. Deal breaker. I have this Thrive with a 32gb micro sd class 10!! Tons of HD video as well as my music collection stored on the sd﻿ card. Great option which is a must for a tablet.
comments.author: BetanceBoys

comments.text: I'm sure there are tablets of the same size which are better available now. This tablet is almost 1 year old, so comparing this tablet to the Nexus﻿ 7 is apples to oranges. The thrive is a great tablet with expandable micro sd capabilities. As always, technology advances and we are left pondering whether we should upgrade or not. As for the commenters who feel the need to compare a tablet released in 2012 (Nexus 7) to a tablet out since early 2011 (Thrive), you are stating the obvious.
comments.author: BetanceBoys
